scorings.justification: The user mentions Mr C's processing-extension certificate that expired on 11 October 2024, indicating a need for a new certificate.
The user explicitly states that Mr C wants to submit an asylum application, which is a clear and direct request.
There is no inquiry or mention of the status of any pending asylum applications.
There is no mention of the expiration of an ATDA (Asylum-Seeker Certificate) in the text.
No request for updating ATDA information is made in the text.
There is no indication that this case involves any Dublin procedure.
Mr C does not identify as a Ukrainian national nor is his request related to this category.
This intention is not applicable as Mr C is not a Ukrainian national.
Mr C is not a Ukrainian national.
There is no indication in the text that Mr C is a student in a mobility program.
There is no mention of Mr C being a trainee in the medical profession.
No difficulties with the ANEF website have been mentioned.
The request does not involve a change of status from student to salaried employee.
There is no mention of changing status from student to job seeker.
There is no application for a "private and family life" residence permit outside the ANEF portal mentioned.
This situation does not apply as there is no mention of issues creating an ANEF account.
No other blockage on the ANEF site is mentioned.
No other ANEF-related problems are mentioned.
Mr C's request to travel to his home country for his father's funeral is clearly stated as an exceptional reason.

list: Without action in the next few days, he risks losing his job.
